findings.title: Excluded[] Length problem
findings.description: Transaction may fail if the length of Excluded array is very large due to extreme gas costs up to the block gas limit and eventually fail the transaction.

findings.title: Unindexed event parameters
findings.description: MinTokensBeforeSwapUpdated, SwapAndLiquify and SwapAndLiquifyEnabledUpdated events don't have any indexed parameters. Unindexed parameters make it difficult to track important data for off-chain monitoring tools.

findings.title: Unnecessary require statement
findings.description: In the constructor, there are three require statements which checks if provided value is greater than or equal to 0. However, those values are of type uint and uint values are always >= 0.

findings.title: Redundant Code
findings.description: The token _tokenTransfer() function in LiquidityGeneratorToken.sol has an if-else block and in the second else if block, there is _transferStandard(sender, recipient, amount). This condition is already satisfied by the else block hence it is safe to remove the extra code from the contract.

findings.title: Use of block.timestamp for trade deadline
findings.description: Deadline set as block.timestamp, In this case of delay too less time margin for the transaction

findings.title: Minimum Amount to receive is zero
findings.description: Minimum amount of output tokens that must be received is 0, which allows trade to execute even when the output amount is very low.
